clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of the Thai Version CPOT and BPS in Postoperative ICU Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of the Thai Version Critical Care Pain Observation Tool and Behavioral Pain Scale in Postoperative Mechanically Ventilated ICU Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The prospective study set forth to test Thai version CPOT and BPS for validity, reliability, and practicality. After translation, both pain scales were tested for concurrent validity, discriminant validity, criterion validity, and inter-rater reliability in patients who were intubated during the postoperative period. Opinions regarding practicality were elicited via questionnaires from nurses who had been using and were familiar with these two pain scales.

detailed_description.textblock: The prospective study set forth to test Thai version CPOT and BPS for validity, reliability, and practicality. After translation, both pain scales were tested for concurrent validity, discriminant validity, criterion validity, and inter-rater reliability in patients who were intubated during the postoperative period. Opinions regarding practicality were elicited via questionnaires from nurses who had been using and were familiar with these two pain scales.

primary_outcome.time_frame: before and after analgesic given during 24 hours postoperative period

secondary_outcome.measure: content validity, concurrent validity, inter-rater reliability, and practicality

intervention.description: test validity and reliability of Thai-version CPOT and BPS

study_pop.textblock: Postoperative Mechanically Ventilated Adult ICU Patients
